timeline.bodyText: Could you merge these 4 as one module? The source codes are duplicated logically.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Each version of the package has a different path, so different versions need to be provided
replies.author: yu199195

replies.bodyText: That is not my asking. I am talking on the maven module perspective.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Maybe they could merge into a module,like this:
sharding-sphere-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-3.x-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-4.x-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-4.1.0-plugin
What do you think, maybe there will be more submodules in the future.
replies.author: yu199195

replies.bodyText: Skywalking doesn't need the different plugin jars to identify the versions, your plugin instrumentation witness definition makes that. So, once you moved the codes into one plugin, you could use separate packages for different versions. Others wouldn't be loaded.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
sharding-sphere-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-3.x-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-4.x-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin
---- sharding-sphere-4.1.0-plugin

If you want, you could, but my point is, there are so many ShardingSphere plugin jars. Are they really so different?
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: sharding-sphere, In previous versions, the named paths of packages have changed, so have many jar, but after 4.0 ~5.0 , it to share one.   5.0 maybe provide annother jar.
replies.author: yu199195

replies.bodyText:
Hi Sheng,
Yes, the class name and method name are so different almost every ShardingSphere release.
As I know, 4.0.0 is different from 4.0.0-RC3, and 4.1.0 is differnent from 4.0.1.
For the 4.1.1 under releasing, same as 4.1.0, they can share a same plugin.
replies.author: tuohai666

replies.bodyText: I still hope you could move all codes in one jar. You could see in the current codebase, there is no plugin for other libs like this :)
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Anyway, this is purely my hope.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Hi，Sheng,
I see your point, But ShardingSphere Changing the package path at release time is too frequent at 4.0.0-RC ,  But inevitably, there will be path changes during version updates, like springMVC3,4,5  They can't be combined into one.  It's just my idea...
replies.author: yu199195

timeline.bodyText: We don't accept this. The version should be accurate. We were facing your version change broke this before.

timeline.bodyText: Could you explain why we need version range? SkyWalking is just requiring the compiling level dependency. I think set up a single version is enough.
